name: Software Design OS
tagline: The AI-native blueprint engine for building software
description: Software Design OS is a hybrid human-AI tool that transforms software ideas into complete, machine-readable blueprints called Software Design Packages (SDPs). It provides a structured 9-stage pipeline that guides users from initial product vision through data modeling, API design, infrastructure planning, and UI specification, producing dual-format outputs (JSON for AI agents, Markdown for humans) at every stage.

problems.problem: Unstructured handoff between product thinking and AI code generation
problems.solution: A 9-stage guided pipeline that captures every critical design decision in a structured format before any code is written

problems.problem: No standard machine-readable format for describing a complete software product
problems.solution: The Software Design Package (SDP) format — a portable, queryable specification with JSON for machines and Markdown for humans

problems.problem: Design decisions live in the developer's head instead of a shared document
problems.solution: Each pipeline stage explicitly captures decisions about database, API, stack, design tokens, and component architecture

problems.problem: Repetitive specification work for every new project
problems.solution: Template system for common product types that pre-fills pipeline stages, plus reusable design patterns

problems.problem: Context scattered across Notion, Figma, dbdiagram, and Terraform
problems.solution: Single unified SDP that contains everything — product context, data models, API contracts, design tokens, component specs, and infrastructure config

features.name: 9-Stage Pipeline
features.description: Guided progression through Product Definition, Data Model, Database Design, API Design, Programming Stack, Design System, Sections, Infrastructure, and Export — each stage validates before unlocking the next

features.name: AI-Powered Generation
features.description: Each pipeline stage uses AI to expand user input into structured specifications. Supports Claude, OpenAI, and any OpenAI-compatible provider

features.name: Dual-Format Output
features.description: Every artifact exists as both structured JSON/YAML (for AI agents) and clean Markdown (for human review) simultaneously

features.name: Software Design Package Export
features.description: Assembles all stage outputs into a portable SDP folder with manifest, cross-reference validation, and downloadable archive

features.name: MCP Server Interface
features.description: Exposes SDP contents as queryable MCP tools so AI coding agents can pull exactly the context they need during development

features.name: Template System
features.description: Reusable starting points for common product types (SaaS dashboard, API service, landing page) that pre-fill pipeline stages

features.name: Cross-Reference Validation
features.description: Export validates that all entity references, API endpoints, design tokens, and section specs are internally consistent

features.name: Cost Tracking
features.description: Every AI generation call is tracked with token counts, cost estimates, and model info — surfaced per-project and in aggregate

personas.name: Solo AI Builder
personas.description: Technical entrepreneur using AI coding agents (Claude Code, Cursor) to build products. Has strong product intuition but needs a structured way to communicate vision to AI agents.

personas.name: Technical Product Manager
personas.description: PM at a startup writing PRDs that engineering teams or AI agents interpret inconsistently. Wants a structured format bridging product thinking and implementation.

personas.name: AI Agent Orchestrator
personas.description: Developer managing multiple AI agents across platforms. Needs a single source of truth (SDP) that any agent can consume regardless of the coding platform.
